p: We performed atomic force microscopic (AFM) measurements to inspect the film morphology. The O5H-OMeDPA film deposited on the poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) polystyrene sulfonate substrate owns a smooth surface with a root mean square deviation of 0.39 nm ( Figure S9). When being coated on the perovskite layer with LiTFSI and TBP as additives, the O5H-OMeDPA film still retains a continuous surface with full surface coverage ( Figure 3A). By contrast, the spiro-OMeTAD control presents plenty of pinholes (the dark region in Figure 3B, marked with a red circle) and LiTFSI aggregates (the light region, marked with a green circle), in line with previous reports ( Wang et al., 2018b).
